member.name: T:Riskmaster.Security.User

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.User.Load(System.Int32)
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.Load uses DbFactory to establish connection with the database. Executes the query to retrieve the entire contents of the USER_TABLE for the input userId to a DbReader object. Invokes LoadData() passing the DbReader object as parameter.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.User.LoadData(Riskmaster.Db.DbReader)
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.LoadData populates the attributes for the User class, from the input DbReader object. If ManagerId is present, ManagerEmail is fetched from the database. ChecksumMatches() function is called to validate user information. Sets the flag m_DataChanged to false.
member.returns: None

member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.Save check for the flag true, than gets a DbWriter object using DbFactory instance and invokes SaveData().

member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.SaveData check for the flag is true, this function updates the user record in the database else creates a new one using writer.

member.summary: OVERLOADED: Class constructor
member.param: string containing the user's Login Name
string containing the user's selected DSN

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.UserLogin.#ctor(Riskmaster.Db.DbReader)
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.UserLogin overload allows internal Data Layer classes to wrap a native reader.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.UserLogin.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.UserLogin overloaded constructor. It uses username, Password and databaseName to retrieve information from USER_DETAILS_TABLE, USER_TABLE and DATA_SOURCE_TABLE through DbReader object, that is further passed to LoadData(). If it is unable to retrieve the data, InvalidUserNameOrPasswordException is thrown.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.UserLogin.UpdatePassword(System.Int32)
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.UpdatePassword uses frmChgPassword object to update PASSWORD and CHECKSUM in USER_DETAILS_TABLE, for a fat client.
member.returns: It returns the boolean value true or false

member.summary: Populates required User Data for authentication calls
member.param: string containing the SQL statement to be executed

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.UserLogin.LoadData(Riskmaster.Db.DbReader)
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.LoadData populates the attributes for the UserLogin class, from the input DbReader object.If OrgSec flag for the Riskmaster database instance is true, the function fetches details from USER_ORGSEC table for the particular user to determine if (s)he is an orgsec admin. Sets the flag m_DataChanged to false.ChecksumMatches() function is called to validate user information

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.UserLogin.Save
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.Save gets a DbWriter object using DbFactory instance and invokes SaveData().

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.UserLogin.SaveData(Riskmaster.Db.DbWriter)
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.SaveData check for the property DataChanged is true, this function updates the attributes of the class to USER_DETAILS_TABLE using writer object. It sets the DbReader object to determine whether the record exists in the table or not. It also invokes sub-object m_objUser’s function SaveData()

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.UserLogin.IsAllowedEx(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.IsAllowedEx is a more sophisticated check whether or not the user "should" according to application configuration settings AND the current user's function list have access to the requested function.
member.returns: It returns true if the user should be allowed to perform the requested function.

members.member: function added by Geeta Sharma for mits 10729

member.name: T:Riskmaster.Security.SecurityDatabase
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.SecurityDatabase class is designed for the database security, It check for the database security on the basis of autorization key and code access public key

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.SecurityDatabase.#cctor
member.summary: Static constructor used to initialize static variables within this class
member.exception: NullReferenceException is thrown if the specified Security Configuration information is not available within the Configuration file
member.remarks: This is specifically needed to initialize the value of the Dsn property the first time it is referenced. Since this is a static property and not an instance based property, a static constructor is required.

member.name: P:Riskmaster.Security.SecurityDatabase.Dsn
member.summary: Gets and sets the Dsn for the RISKMASTER Security Database
member.returns: It returns the DSN name as a string
member.remarks: The current implementation is too highly coupled with the Riskmaster.config file for retrieving security credentials/application information especially since this is implemented as a static property. Because this is additionally implemented statically, it will also be invisible to COM libraries thus making it unavailable to legacy applications. In order for this library to be usable by both .Net and COM libraries, the entire Riskmaster.Security library needs to be implemented based on instance methods rather than static methods and properties

member.name: T:Riskmaster.Security.RiskmasterDatabase
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.RiskmasterDatabase class is an Public class is used for connecting,identifying and setting various parameters for riskmaster database. This also checks license grants, checks security for userid password, identifies datetime.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.RiskmasterDatabase.#ctor
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.RiskmasterDatabase is internal constructor without any parameter.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.RiskmasterDatabase.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.RiskmasterDatabase is the constructor with parameter. Constructor call after the attribute [System.Security.Permissions.StrongNameIdentityPermission(System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction.LinkDemand, PublicKey=UtilityFunctions.CODE_ACCESS_PUBLICKEY)] This constructor calls the function Load() and serves as a wrapper.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.RiskmasterDatabase.#ctor(Riskmaster.Db.DbReader)
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.RiskmasterDatabase overload allows internal data layer classes to wrap a native reader

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.RiskmasterDatabase.ParseDocPathCredentials(System.String)
member.summary: Riskmaster.Db.DbConnection.ParseDocPathCredentials supports the Document Database by decrypting the uid and pwd sections of the connection string and returning the fully modified connection string.
member.param: The connection string in which to effect the change.
member.returns: An updated version of the connection string from docPath.
member.remarks: There may be ODBC niceties like {} or escape sequences that are not handled properly here yet.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.RiskmasterDatabase.LoadData(Riskmaster.Db.DbReader)
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.LoadData is the internal function Internal functions gets the values of various class parameters from the passed reader object. Then checks those database parameters by making a connection string. Calls ChecksumMatches() and CRCMatches() function to check those parameters . If these parameters not found matching it raises Riskmaster.ExceptionTypes.InvalidChecksumException.

member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.SaveData check for the flag is true, this function updates the user record in the database else creates a new one using writer.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.RiskmasterDatabase.GrantLicense(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.GrantLicense Internal function checks bSuppressLicense is true and NumLicenses parameter is –1 else checks no of connection to the database is less then no of connection license granted . Returns false if any of above criteria fails. Also if this license checking mechanism fails raises exception.

member.name: T:Riskmaster.Security.Login
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.Login wraps a native provider Component object. This class is designed to do the primary authentication.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.Login.#ctor
member.summary: Default class constructor
member.remarks: Should no longer be used since this requires a reference handle to the Windows 32-bit registry and therefore limits usage of the Login class to only 32-bit OSes

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.Login.#ctor(System.Collections.Specialized.StringDictionary)
member.summary: Overloaded class constructor
member.param: StringDictionary value contains key-value pairs which determine how the ultimate security database connection string will be constructed

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.Login.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Overloaded class constructor
member.param: string containing the database connection string to the Riskmaster Security database
member.remarks: The database connection string to the Riskmaster Security database could be either a System DSN or a fully qualified (OLEDB/ODBC etc.) database connection string

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.Login.GetDatabases
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.GetDatabases takes the reference of the native provider DbConnection,DbFactory.GetDbConnection and DbReader. GetDbConnection returns a DbConnection and DbConnection is resposible for reader,transaction, command.
member.returns: It return the database name

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.Login.GetUserDatabases(System.String)
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.GetUserDatabases returns the list of DSN's that this UserLogin name should have access to. Note: It does not do a full authorization request for each DSN, only tests that this user is configured as a login for each DSN returned.
member.returns: string array of DSN Names.
member.remarks: Note: This override provides the same lookup as the version that takes a password but simply assumes that the password will be the same accross all available datasources for the given UserName. This is a change going forward to support the idea of "hot-swapping" your database with-out fully logging off of the system. The primary reason for this is to deal with Single Sign-On (SSO). In that case, password is logically an attribute of the User, not the UserLogin anymore.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.Login.GetUserDatabases(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.GetUserDatabases returns the list of DSN's that this UserLogin name should have access to. Note: It does not do a full authorization request for each DSN, only tests that this user is configured as a login for each DSN returned.
member.returns: string array of DSN names.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.Login.bNoAutoLogin
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.bNoAutoLogin is the internal function which return based on Registry Setting
member.returns: It returns login status true or false

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.Login.CheckMemMap(Riskmaster.Security.LoginDlgInfo@)
member.summary: Private utility function Riskmaster.Security.CheckMemMap used to get the current session id for use building a properly scoped Shared Memory Map Name in a Terminal Services situation.
member.returns: It returns boolean

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.Login.GetSharedMemName
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.GetSharedMemName gets shared memory name by passing the session id.
member.returns: It returns string -"RMLOGINSILENTLOGIN" with sessionid if is terminal server

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.Login.GetIsTerminalServer
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.GetIsTerminalServer simple internal function to determine if we are running under terminal server or not.
member.returns: It returns boolean value based on product option as terminal server

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.Login.RegisterApplication(System.Int32,System.Int32,Riskmaster.Security.UserLogin@)
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.RegisterApplication takes the refernce of the natvive providers. It is called from the Client desktop layer by passing the Application Window with reference to Userlogin.
member.param: To get the handle of desktop window
Object reference to the class UsrLogin

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.Login.AuthenticateUser(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.AuthenticateUser called from Internet Client Layer. It wraps up the native providers.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Security.Login.AuthUser(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.AuthUser wraps the native provider. It check the following 1. Permissions and Password Expiration, 2. Permissions to login today. Raise the PermissionExpired exception if user cannot login 3. Checksum's and CRC for the License Info (Handled at object level.) 4. Check number of seat licences against number of currently logged in machines. It do the following, 1. Write a row into the MACHINE_LOGIN table (if necessary). 2. Load User Security settings. 3. Apply any Organizational Security (aka "BES") Login Settings (Handled at object level.)
member.returns: It returns the object of class UserLogin

member.summary: Riskmaster.Security.Dispose is used to clean up File Mapping Object.
member.returns: None

member.returns: It returns the sared memory map name with refference to the object of memory mapped data structure

member.name: T:Riskmaster.Security.LoginDlgInfo
member.summary: Memory Mapped Data Structure
member.remarks: Data is maintained as ascii by previous login component. Hence, we must store as ascii instead of the default UTF16 of the CLR. IFF this is maintained as is - it will interoperate with older compnonents using the same memory maps.
